snippet: Strong private consumption, residential investment and corporate spending were the biggest contributors to growth, while public spending fell slightly.
abstract: Preliminary data shows Japan's economy grew at a 5.9 annualized rate in January-March 2014 quarter; growth figures released are in line with expectations; quarter-to-quarter growth, adjusted for inflation, was 1.5 percent.
lead_paragraph: Strong private consumption, residential investment and corporate spending were the biggest contributors to growth, while public spending fell slightly.

headline.main: Growth in Japan Rises at Fastest Rate in Two Years
headline.print_headline: Growth in Japan Rises at Fastest Rate in Two Years
